snippet: Unwilling to risk a confrontation with the supreme leader, who has backed the deal, Iranian hard-liners are waiting for a misstep to unleash criticism and huge protests.
abstract: Iran's hard-liners remain unsupportive of nuclear deal signed with United States and other world powers but are keeping their criticisms to themselves, unwilling to risk public confrontation with Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, who has cautiously welcomed deal; hard-liners are ready to unleash large-scale protests at slightest misstep or signal from Khamenei.
lead_paragraph: Unwilling to risk a confrontation with the supreme leader, who has backed the deal, Iranian hard-liners are waiting for a misstep to unleash criticism and huge protests.

headline.main: Iran’s Hard-Liners Keep Their Criticism of Nuclear Pact to Themselves
headline.print_headline: Iran’s Hard-Liners Keep Their Criticism of Nuclear Pact to Themselves
